p: The patients infected with influenza virus display a marked increase in DNA, lipid and protein oxidation products in blood plasma and urine [ 41, 114, 115, 116]. Models of mice and cell lines infected with influenza viruses also show an enhanced production of ROS together with an imbalance of antioxidant defense [ 117, 118, 119, 120]. These models are relevant to study the changes in redox homeostasis induced by the influenza virus.
